availableToPartners.description: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.
availableToPartners.name: availableToPartners

billingSchedule.externalId.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.externalId.name: billingSchedule.externalId

billingSchedule.internalId.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.internalId.name: billingSchedule.internalId

billingSchedule.name.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.name.name: billingSchedule.name

costEstimate.description: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.
costEstimate.name: costEstimate

costEstimateType.value.description: The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased.     * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions.     * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.
costEstimateType.value.name: costEstimateType.value

createRevenuePlansOn.externalId.description: Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.
createRevenuePlansOn.externalId.displayName: Create Revenue Plans On - External id
createRevenuePlansOn.externalId.name: createRevenuePlansOn.externalId

createRevenuePlansOn.internalId.description: Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.
createRevenuePlansOn.internalId.displayName: Create Revenue Plans On - Internal id
createRevenuePlansOn.internalId.name: createRevenuePlansOn.internalId

createRevenuePlansOn.name.description: Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.
createRevenuePlansOn.name.name: createRevenuePlansOn.name

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

daysBeforeExpiration.description: If you want this item to expire, enter the number of days it should remain active after purchase.If this item is downloadable and the same customer purchases this item more than once, the countdown to expiration restarts with each purchase.Note: If this item is a gift certificate and the buyer lives in California, Connecticut, Louisiana, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island or Washington, by law the gift certificate cannot expire.
daysBeforeExpiration.name: daysBeforeExpiration

deferRevRec.description: Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.
deferRevRec.name: deferRevRec

deferredRevenueAccount.externalId.description: Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
deferredRevenueAccount.externalId.name: deferredRevenueAccount.externalId

deferredRevenueAccount.internalId.description: Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
deferredRevenueAccount.internalId.name: deferredRevenueAccount.internalId

deferredRevenueAccount.name.description: Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
deferredRevenueAccount.name.name: deferredRevenueAccount.name

department.externalId.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.
department.name.name: department.name

directRevenuePosting.description: Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.By default, this box is not checked.
directRevenuePosting.name: directRevenuePosting

displayName.description: You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.
displayName.name: displayName

dontShowPrice.description: Check this box to hide the price of this item online.This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.
dontShowPrice.name: dontShowPrice

excludeFromSitemap.description: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.
excludeFromSitemap.name: excludeFromSitemap

featuredDescription.description: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.
featuredDescription.name: featuredDescription

immediateDownload.description: Check this box if you want customers to be able to download the item immediately after checking out.Clear this box to make download available after the order is billed. Customers then receive email that the download is available through the My Account tab of your site.
immediateDownload.name: immediateDownload

includeChildren.description: Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries. For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.
includeChildren.name: includeChildren

incomeAccount.externalId.description: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
incomeAccount.externalId.name: incomeAccount.externalId

incomeAccount.internalId.description: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
incomeAccount.internalId.name: incomeAccount.internalId

incomeAccount.name.description: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
incomeAccount.name.name: incomeAccount.name

isDonationItem.description: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.
isDonationItem.name: isDonationItem

isFulfillable.description: Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.
isFulfillable.name: isFulfillable

isGcoCompliant.description: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.
isGcoCompliant.name: isGcoCompliant

isInactive.description: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.
isInactive.name: isInactive

isOnline.description: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.
isOnline.name: isOnline

isTaxable.description: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.
isTaxable.name: isTaxable

issueProduct.externalId.description: Select the product this item is associated with.Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.
issueProduct.externalId.name: issueProduct.externalId

issueProduct.internalId.description: Select the product this item is associated with.Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.
issueProduct.internalId.name: issueProduct.internalId

issueProduct.name.description: Select the product this item is associated with.Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.
issueProduct.name.name: issueProduct.name

itemId.description: Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.
itemId.name: itemId

itemRevenueCategory.externalId.description: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.
itemRevenueCategory.externalId.name: itemRevenueCategory.externalId

itemRevenueCategory.internalId.description: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.
itemRevenueCategory.internalId.name: itemRevenueCategory.internalId

itemRevenueCategory.name.description: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.
itemRevenueCategory.name.name: itemRevenueCategory.name

location.externalId.description: Select a location to associate with this item.To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.      For more information click here.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.      For more information click here.Select New to enter a new location record.Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: Select a location to associate with this item.To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.      For more information click here.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.      For more information click here.Select New to enter a new location record.Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: Select a location to associate with this item.To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.      For more information click here.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.      For more information click here.Select New to enter a new location record.Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.
location.name.name: location.name

maxDonationAmount.description: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.
maxDonationAmount.name: maxDonationAmount

metaTagHtml.description: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.
metaTagHtml.name: metaTagHtml

noPriceMessage.description: If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.For example, you might enter "Call for Price."
noPriceMessage.name: noPriceMessage

numOfAllowedDownloads.description: Enter the maximum number of times a customer who has purchased this item can download it from the Customer Center.If the same customer purchases this item more than once, the number of available downloads is multiplied by the number of times the item has been purchased.
numOfAllowedDownloads.name: numOfAllowedDownloads

offerSupport.description: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.
offerSupport.name: offerSupport

onSpecial.description: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.
onSpecial.name: onSpecial

outOfStockBehavior.value.description: Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall siteâ€™s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages    * Remove items when out of stock    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message
outOfStockBehavior.value.name: outOfStockBehavior.value

outOfStockMessage.description: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.
outOfStockMessage.name: outOfStockMessage

pageTitle.description: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.
pageTitle.name: pageTitle

parent.externalId.description: References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
parent.externalId.name: parent.externalId

parent.internalId.description: References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
parent.internalId.name: parent.internalId

parent.name.description: References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
parent.name.name: parent.name

pricingGroup.externalId.description: Select the pricing group this item is a member of.Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.
pricingGroup.externalId.name: pricingGroup.externalId

pricingGroup.internalId.description: Select the pricing group this item is a member of.Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.
pricingGroup.internalId.name: pricingGroup.internalId

pricingGroup.name.description: Select the pricing group this item is a member of.Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.
pricingGroup.name.name: pricingGroup.name

quantityPricingSchedule.externalId.description: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.
quantityPricingSchedule.externalId.name: quantityPricingSchedule.externalId

quantityPricingSchedule.internalId.description: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.
quantityPricingSchedule.internalId.name: quantityPricingSchedule.internalId

quantityPricingSchedule.name.description: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.
quantityPricingSchedule.name.name: quantityPricingSchedule.name

relatedItemsDescription.description: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.
relatedItemsDescription.name: relatedItemsDescription

revRecForecastRule.externalId.description: Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.
revRecForecastRule.externalId.displayName: Rev Rec Forecast Rule - External id
revRecForecastRule.externalId.name: revRecForecastRule.externalId

revRecForecastRule.internalId.description: Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.
revRecForecastRule.internalId.displayName: Rev Rec Forecast Rule - Internal id
revRecForecastRule.internalId.name: revRecForecastRule.internalId

revRecForecastRule.name.description: Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.
revRecForecastRule.name.name: revRecForecastRule.name

revRecSchedule.externalId.description: Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
revRecSchedule.externalId.name: revRecSchedule.externalId

revRecSchedule.internalId.description: Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
revRecSchedule.internalId.name: revRecSchedule.internalId

revRecSchedule.name.description: Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
revRecSchedule.name.name: revRecSchedule.name

revenueAllocationGroup.externalId.description: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.
revenueAllocationGroup.externalId.name: revenueAllocationGroup.externalId

revenueAllocationGroup.internalId.description: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.
revenueAllocationGroup.internalId.name: revenueAllocationGroup.internalId

revenueAllocationGroup.name.description: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.
revenueAllocationGroup.name.name: revenueAllocationGroup.name

revenueRecognitionRule.externalId.description: Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.
revenueRecognitionRule.externalId.name: revenueRecognitionRule.externalId

revenueRecognitionRule.internalId.description: Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.
revenueRecognitionRule.internalId.name: revenueRecognitionRule.internalId

revenueRecognitionRule.name.description: Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.
revenueRecognitionRule.name.name: revenueRecognitionRule.name

salesDescription.description: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.
salesDescription.name: salesDescription

searchKeywords.description: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web storeï¿½s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.
searchKeywords.name: searchKeywords

showDefaultDonationAmount.description: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.
showDefaultDonationAmount.name: showDefaultDonationAmount

sitemapPriority.value.description: Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.NetSuite assigns the default priority â€œAutoâ€ to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.
sitemapPriority.value.name: sitemapPriority.value

specialsDescription.description: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.
specialsDescription.name: specialsDescription

storeDescription.description: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.
storeDescription.name: storeDescription

storeDetailedDescription.description: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.
storeDetailedDescription.name: storeDetailedDescription

storeDisplayImage.externalId.description: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
storeDisplayImage.externalId.name: storeDisplayImage.externalId

storeDisplayImage.internalId.description: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
storeDisplayImage.internalId.name: storeDisplayImage.internalId

storeDisplayImage.name.description: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
storeDisplayImage.name.name: storeDisplayImage.name

storeDisplayName.description: Sets the item name for your Web site.
storeDisplayName.name: storeDisplayName

storeDisplayThumbnail.externalId.description: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

storeDisplayThumbnail.internalId.description: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
storeDisplayThumbnail.internalId.name: storeDisplayThumbnail.internalId

storeDisplayThumbnail.name.name: storeDisplayThumbnail.name

storeItemTemplate.externalId.description: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.
storeItemTemplate.externalId.name: storeItemTemplate.externalId

storeItemTemplate.internalId.description: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.
storeItemTemplate.internalId.name: storeItemTemplate.internalId

storeItemTemplate.name.description: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

taxSchedule.externalId.description: Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.
taxSchedule.externalId.name: taxSchedule.externalId

taxSchedule.internalId.description: Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.
taxSchedule.internalId.name: taxSchedule.internalId

taxSchedule.name.description: Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.
taxSchedule.name.name: taxSchedule.name

type.value.description: Select a location to associate with this item.To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.      For more information click here.    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.      For more information click here.Select New to enter a new location record.Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.
type.value.name: type.value

upcCode.description: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.
upcCode.name: upcCode

useMarginalRates.description: Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.
useMarginalRates.name: useMarginalRates

vsoeDeferral.value.description: In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:_deferBundleUntilDelivered ï¿½ Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered._deferUntilItemDelivered ï¿½ Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.
vsoeDeferral.value.name: vsoeDeferral.value

vsoeDelivered.description: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.
vsoeDelivered.name: vsoeDelivered

vsoePermitDiscount.value.description: Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item._asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed._never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.
vsoePermitDiscount.value.name: vsoePermitDiscount.value

vsoePrice.description: Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.
vsoePrice.name: vsoePrice

vsoeSopGroup.value.description: Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.
vsoeSopGroup.value.name: vsoeSopGroup.value
